namedStyle.description: Specifies the default font family list ("font-family" property) for the skin.
Specifies the default font for the skin. This style defines both the default font family (as specified by the AFDefaultFontFamily named style), the default font size, and default font weight.
A bold version of the default font.
A very small version of the default font. This style is used for very small text such as inline messages, and copyright and privacy messages.
A small version of the default font. This style is used for text which is slightly smaller than the default, such as af:menuPath links.
A version of the default font which is slightly larger than the default size. This is used for medium sized text, such as level 2 headers.
A large version of the default font. This is used for large text, such as level 1 headers.
A very large version of the default font.
The primary background color in the core color ramp.
The darkest background color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkBackground:alias color.
A slightly lighter background color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkBackground:alias color.
The lightest background color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkBackground:alias color.
The primary background color in the accent color ramp.
The darkest background color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkAccentBackground:alias color.
A slightly lighter background color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkAccentBackground:alias color.
The lightest background color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkAccentBackground:alias color.
The default text background color (white).
The primary foreground color in the core color ramp.
The darkest foreground color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkForeground:alias color.
A slightly lighter foreground color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkForeground:alias color.
The lightest foreground color in the core color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkForeground:alias color.
The primary foreground color in the accent color ramp.
The darkest foreground color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkAccentForeground:alias color.
A slightly lighter foreground color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkAccentForeground:alias color.
The lightest foreground color in the accent color ramp. This value is computed relative to the .AFDarkAccentForeground:alias color.
The default text foreground color (black).
The foreground color for selected/highlighted text, or text which is drawn on a dark background.
The foreground color for error text (red).
The default foreground color for inactive, unvisited links.
The default foreground color for active links.
The default foreground color for visited links.
The default foreground color for disabled links.
The primary border color in the core color ramp.
The darkest border color in the core color ramp.
A slightly lighter border color in the core color ramp.
The lightest border color in the core color ramp.
The primary border color in the accent color ramp.
The darkest border color in the accent color ramp.
A slightly lighter border color in the accent color ramp.
The lightest border color in the accent color ramp.
Sets the text-align property to "left" for left-to-right reading direction and "right" for right-to-left reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "right" for left-to-right reading direction and "left" for right-to-left reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "left" regardless of the reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "right" regardless of the reading direction.
Sets the text-align property to "center" regardless of the reading direction.

selector.description: Style class for text displayed in af:select* components and in inputText.
Style class for text displayed in disabled af:select* components and in inputText.
Style class for text displayed in prompts.
Styles the AFErrorIcon icons.
Styles the AFWarningIcon icons.
Styles the AFInfoIcon icons.
Styles the AFRequiredIcon icon.

icon.description: The error icon is used by the form components (eg. selectInputText, selectBooleanCheckbox, etc...) to indicate that an error has occurred.
The AFErrorAnchorIconicon is a version of the error icon that is displayed when the icon is used as a link to additional information about the error.
The AFInfoIcon icon is used by the form components (eg. selectInputText, selectBooleanCheckbox, etc...) to indicate that an informational message is being displayed to the user.
The AFInfoAnchorIcon icon is a version of the info icon that is displayed when the icon is used as a link to additional information.
The AFRequiredIcon icon is used by the form components (eg. selectInputText, selectBooleanCheckbox, etc...) to indicate that a value must be specified.
The AFWarningIcon icon is used by the form components (eg. selectInputText, selectBooleanCheckbox, etc...) to indicate that an warning message is being displayed to the user.
The AFWarningAnchorIcon icon is a version of the warning icon that is displayed when the icon is used as a link to additional information about the warning.

description.html:p: The simple skin supports two very different button implementations. By default, standard browser buttons are used. However, the simple skin also supports dynamic generation of image-based buttons. In order to enable image-based buttons, the following four button icon must be specified: .AFButtonStartIcon:alias, .AFButtonEndIcon:alias,.AFButtonTopBackgroundIcon:alias, .AFButtonBottomBackgroundIcon:alias. When these four icons are specified, ADF Faces combines the images specified by these icons into a single button image. (Note: These icons must be specified using either context-image or resource-image icons. Text-based icons are not allowed, and the other image icon types are not currently supported.)

namedStyle.description: This aliased style is used to provide the foreground color, background color, and font information for server-side generated buttons. You can set attributes background-color, color, -ora-text-antialias, font-size, font-family.

This aliased style is used to provide the foreground color, background color, and font information for server-side generated disabled buttons. You can attributes background-color, color, -ora-text-antialias, font-size, font-family.

selector.description: The BUTTON selector is used to apply styles to browser-based buttons.

icon.description: This icon is rendered at the starting side of the button. That is, this image appears on the left side of the button when the reading direction is right-to-left, and the right side of the button when the reading direction is left-to-right.

This icon is rendered at the ending side of the button. That is, this image appears on the right side of the button when the reading direction is right-to-left, and the left side of the button when the reading direction is left-to-right.
This image is tiled horizontally along the top of the button, providing the button's top border.
This image is tiled horizontally along the bottom of the button, providing the button's bottom border.
This icon is rendered at the starting side of disabled buttons. If this icon is not specified, the buttonStart icon will be used instead.
This icon is rendered at the ending side of disabled button. If this icon is not specified, the buttonEnd icon will be used instead.
This icon is tiled horizontally along the top of disabled buttons. If this icon is not specified, the buttonTopBackground icon will be used instead.
This icon is tiled horizontally along the bottom of the disabled buttons. If this icon is not specified, the buttonBottomBackground icon will be used instead.

styleClass.description: Specifies the style information for the afh:body content.

selector.description: Style class for chooseDate's navigation icons.
Style class for chooseDate title.
Style class for chooseDate header.
Style class for chooseDate content.
Style class for selected date.

styleClass.description: This style class is used to style the sortableHeader's sort icons.

selector.description: Specifies properties for text cells.
Specifies properties for banded text cells.
Specifies properties for numeric cells.
Specifies properties for banded numeric cells.
Specifies properties for icon cells.
Specifies properties for banded icon cells.
Specifies properties for column headers.
Specifies properties for numeric column headers.
Specifies properties for icon column headers.
Specifies properties for row headers.
Specifies properties for text total row cells.
Specifies properties for numeric total row cells.
Specifies properties for sortable column headers.
Specifies properties for numeric sortable column headers.
Specifies properties for icon sortable column headers.

icon.description: This icon is used to indicate that the column is sorted in ascending order.
This icon is used to indicate that the column is sorted in descending order.
This icon is used to indicate that the column is unsorted. Used in the oracle.adf.pda renderKit only.

description.html:p: The Simple Skin af:menuBar is implemented using an inner table nested within an outer table. The outer table contains cells for the af|menuBar::start-icon and af|menuBar::end-icon icons, as well as a cell for the nested inner table. The inner table contains the actual contents of the menuBar - which includes the af:menuBar items if any items exist, or possibly the af:menuBar title if no items are specified.

Style properties can be applied to either the outer table or the inner table, depending on how the styles are meant to be used. The af|menuBar style can be used to apply styles to the entire menuBar - including the af|menuBar::start-icon/af|menuBar::end-icon icons. Note, however, that if these icons are transparent, then setting the background color or borders on the af|menuBar style class itself is probably not desirable, since the background color will show through any transparent pixels in the icons.

Three other styles can be used to apply styles to the inner contents of the af:menuBar (not including the af|menuBar::start-icon and af|menuBar::end-icon icons). If the af:menuBar contains any items, the af|menuBar::body style class is used to style the inner table which contains the items. This is a good choice for specifying a background color for the af:menuBar, since this background color is not applied to the af:menuBar's outer icons. If no af:menuBar items are present, but the af:menuBar's text attribute is specified, the af|menuBar::title style class is rendered on the inner table instead of af|menuBar::body. If no children are present and there is no title, the af|menuBar::empty title is used.

styleClass.description: The af|menuBar style class is associated with the menuBar container itself.
This style class is rendered on the menuBar's inner table when the menuBar contains child items.
This style class is rendered on the menuBar's inner table when the menuBar does not contain any child items but does have its text attribute set.
This style class is used to style empty menuBars - that is, menuBars which do not have any children or a title.
The af|menuBar::enabled style class is associated with enabled items in the menuBar.
The af|menuBar::enabled style class is associated with selected items in the menuBar.
The af|menuBar::enabled style class is associated with the menuBar separator items.

selector.description: This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to enabled links in the menuBar.
This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to the selected link in the menuBar.

namedStyle.description: The AFMenuBarItem:alias style defines style properties that are shared by all menuBar items. This named styles is included by the af|menuBar::enabled and af|menuBar::selected style classes.

The AFGlobalHeaderLink:alias style defines style properties that are shared by all links within the menuBar. This named style is included by the "af|menuBar::enabled-link" and "af|menuBar::selected-link" selectors.

icon.description: This icon is rendered at the start of the af|menuBar.
This icon is rendered at the end of the af|menuBar.
This icon is rendered before the first item in the af|menuBar.
This icon is rendered after the last item in the af|menuBar.
This icon is rendered as the background of the af|menuBar.
The af:menuBar icon is rendered between items.

styleClass.description: Style class used for enabled menu buttons item text.
Style class used for selected menu buttons text.
Style class used for disabled menu buttons text.

namedStyle.description: The AFMenuButtons:alias style defines style properties that are shared by all menuButtons selectors: af|menuButtons::text, af|menuButtons::text-selected, and af|menuButtons::text-disabled.

selector.description: Specifies the style information for the af:menuChoice's label text.
Style class for menuList.
Style class for selected menuList.
Specifies the style information for the af:menuPath content.
Specifies the style information for the selected af:menuPath step. This step may be hidden.
Specifies the style information for af:menuPath steps.

namedStyle.description: This alias namedStyle is included in both af|menuPath and af|treeTable::path
This alias namedStyle is included in both af|menuPath::step and af|treeTable::path-step
This alias namedStyle is included in both af|menuPath::selected-step and af|treeTable::path-selected-step

icon.description: The separator icon that is rendered between af:menuPath links. This is typically a text icon.
Changing this icon changes both af|menuPath::separator-icon and af|treeTable::separator-icon

property.description: Valid values are true or false. Determines whether the last item is displayed or not.

description.html:p: The tabBar can be customized via the styles described below.

selector.description: The af|menuTabs style class is associated with the tabBar container itself.
The af|menuTabs::enabled style class is associated with enabled items in the tabBar.
The af|menuTabs::selected style class is associated with the selected item in the tabBar.
The af|menuTabs::disabled style class is associated with disabled items in the tabBar.
This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to enabled links in the tabBar.
This selector is used to apply link-specific styles to the selected link in the tabBar.

namedStyle.description: The AFTabBarItem:alias named style defines style properties that are shared by all menuTabs items. This alias style is included by the af|menuTabs::enabled, af|menuTabs::selected and af|menuTabs::disabled style classes.

The AFTabBarLink:alias style defines style properties that are shared by all links within the tabBar. This alias style is included by the "af|menuTabs::enabled-link" and "af|menuTabs::selected-link" selectors.

icon.description: The af|menuTabs::enabled-start icon is rendered at the start of each enabled menuTab item.
The af|menuTabs::enabled-end icon is rendered at the end of each enabled menuTab item.
The af|menuTabs::enabled-background icon is rendered in the background each enabled menuTab item.
The af|menuTabs::selected-start icon is rendered at the start of the selected menuTab item.
The af|menuTabs::selected-end icon is rendered at the end of the selected menuTab item.
The af|menuTabs::selected-background icon is rendered in the background the selected menuTab item.
The af|menuTabs::enabled-join icon is rendered in between two enabled menuTab items.

The af|menuTabs::enabled-selected-join icon is rendered in between an enabled tabBar item and the selected menuTab item. That is, when the reading direction is left to right, the join connects an enabled item with a selected item to the right of the enabled item.

The af|menuTabs::selected-enabled-join icon is rendered in between the selected menuTab item and an enabled menuTab item. That is, when the reading direction is left to right, the join connects a selected item with an enabled item to the right of the selected item.

component.name: af:menuTree
component.description: The af:menuTree component allows the disclosure indicator icon to be customized.

icon.description: The af|menuTree::disclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:menuTree component is rendered in its disclosed state.
The af|menuTree::undisclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:menuTree component is rendered in its undisclosed state.
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::disclosed-icon, af|showDetail::disclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::disclosed-icon, af|menuTree::disclosed-icon
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetail::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::undisclosed-icon, af|menuTree::undisclosed-icon

description.html:p: This messages component is implemented using an inner table nested within an outer table. The outer container is used to lay out the messages' icons. The inner container contains the actual contents of the messages. If any transparent icons are used, style properties such as the background color should probably be set on the inner table via the af|messages::body selector.

selector.description: This named style is included by af|messages::header and af|messages::error, as well as the af|*::level-one selectors and af|panelHeader::error

This selector is rendered on the messages's outer table. Since the messages's icons are rendered within the outer table, the af|message::body selector is probably a better choice for specifying the messages's background color, padding, etc...
This selector is rendered on the messages's inner table, which does not include any outer icons.

icon.description: This icon is rendered at the top starting corner of the messages (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered at the top ending corner of the messages (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the background in between the af|messages::top-start-icon and af|messages::top-end-icon icons.
This icon is rendered at the bottom starting corner of the messages (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered at the bottom ending corner of the messages (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the background in between the af|messages::bottom-start-icon and af|messages::bottom-end-icon icons.
This icon is rendered in the background at the start of the messages.
This icon is rendered in the background at the end of the messages.
The icon that is displayed for error messages.
The icon that is displayed for warning messages.
The icon that is displayed for information messages.
The icon that is displayed for confirmation messages.
The icon that is displayed for error messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::error-icon and af|messages::error-icon
The icon that is displayed for warning messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::warning-icon and af|messages::warning-icon
The icon that is displayed for information messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::info-icon and af|messages::info-icon
The icon that is displayed for confirmation messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::confirmation-icon and af|messages::confirmation-icon

selector.description: This selector is used to style the af:objectSeparator component.

description.html:p: The panelBox contains two main regions: the body region, which contains the panelBox contents, and the header region, which contains the panelBox header text. Styles can be applied to the body region via the af|panelBox::body style class. Similarly, styles for the header region are specified via the af|panelBox::header style class.

These two regions are themselves rendered within an outer container that can be styled as well. There are two different sets of style classes for the outer region, depending on whether a header is present. If a header is present, one of the following style classes is used, depending on the panelBox background color (background color can be quickly configured to dark, medium, or light using the background attribute on panelBox).
If no header is present, the outer container instead uses the following style classes:

In order to apply a style to the panelBox body or header for a particular background type, a contextual selector can be used. For example, the following selectors can be used to change the properties of dark panelBox header and body regions:
description.html:pre: <style selector="af|panelBox::dark af|panelBox::header"> <!-- Style properties for dark panelBox header --> </style> <style selector="af|panelBox::dark af|panelBox::body"> <!-- Style properties for dark panelBox body --> </style>
description.html:p: And the following selector can be used to change the properties of the dark panelBox body for panelBox which do not have a header:
description.html:pre: <style selector="af|panelBox::content-dark af|panelBox::body"> <!-- Style properties for dark headerless panelBox body --> </style>
description.html:p: In order to make it easier to apply common style properties across panelBox of different background types, several alias styles are exposed. For example, the .AFPanelBoxDarkBackground:alias aliased style provides a way to set the background color for all dark panelBox. This aliased style is used regardless of whether the outer container uses the af|panelBox::dark or af|panelBox::content-dark style class (ie. whether or not a header is present). See the named style section below for a list all of the available named styles.

styleClass.description: This style class is associated with the body region of the panelBox.
This style class is associated with the header region of the panelBox.
This style class is associated with the outer container of dark panelBox.
This style class is associated with the outer container of medium panelBox.
This style class is associated with the outer container of light panelBox.
This style class is associated with the outer container of transparent panelBox.
This style class is used in place of the af|panelBox::dark style class for panelBox which do not have a header.
This style class is used in place of the af|panelBox::medium style class for panelBox which do not have a header.
This style class is used in place of the af|panelBox::light style class for panelBox which do not have a header.
This style class is used in place of the af|panelBox::transparent style class for panelBox which do not have a header.

namedStyle.description: This aliased style can be used to specify common properties that are shared by the af|panelBox::dark, af|panelBox::medium, af|panelBox::light and af|panelBox::transparent style classes (classes when the panelBox has a header).

This aliased style can be used to specify common properties that are shared by the af|panelBox::content-dark, af|panelBox::content-medium, af|panelBox::content-light and af|panelBox::content-transparent style classes. AFShuttleBoxContent:alias includes this style.

description.html:p: This aliased style class be used to specify common properties that are shared by the four types of the panelBox<Background> body regions. It is included by the following selectors:
This aliased style class be used to specify common properties that are shared by the four types of the af|panelBox::content<Background> body regions. It is included by the following selectors:
This aliased style is used to set the background color for dark panelBox. It is included by the following selectors:
This aliased style is used to set the background color for medium panelBox. It is included by the following selectors:
This aliased style is used to set the background color for light panelBox and for the seletMany/selectOrder shuttle's box. It is included by the following selectors:

icons.description: The panelBox defines four sets of icons: one set for each background type. Customizers are not required to specify icons for all of the different icon names. If an icon is omitted, the panelBox will attempt to expand to fill any empty space.

icon.description: This icon is rendered at the start of the header region for dark panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the end of the header region for dark panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the background of the header region for dark panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the body region of dark panelBoxes at the bottom starting corner (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of dark panelBoxes at the bottom ending corner (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of dark panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::dark-bottom-start and af|panelBox::dark-bottom-end icons.

This icon is rendered in the body region of dark panelBoxes at the top starting corner (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of dark panelBoxes at the top ending corner (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of dark panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::dark-top-start and af|panelBox::dark-top-end icons. Note: the top icons are only rendered for contentContainers which do not have headers.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the starting side of the body region in dark panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the ending side of the body region in dark panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the start of the header region for medium panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the end of the header region for medium panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the background of the header region for medium panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the body region of medium panelBoxes at the bottom starting corner (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of medium panelBoxes at the bottom ending corner (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of medium panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::medium-bottom-start and af|panelBox::medium-bottom-end icons.

This icon is rendered in the body region of medium panelBoxes at the top starting corner (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of medium panelBoxes at the top ending corner (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of medium panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::medium-top-start and af|panelBox::medium-top-end icons. Note: the top icons are only rendered for contentContainers which do not have headers.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the starting side of the body region in medium panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the ending side of the body region in medium panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the start of the header region for light panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the end of the header region for light panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the background of the header region for light panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the body region of light panelBoxes at the bottom starting corner (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of light panelBoxes at the bottom ending corner (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of light panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::light-bottom-start and af|panelBox::light-bottom-end icons.

This icon is rendered in the body region of light panelBoxes at the top starting corner (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of light panelBoxes at the top ending corner (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of light panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::light-top-start and af|panelBox::light-top-end icons. Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.w
This icon is rendered as the background image on the starting side of the body region in light panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the ending side of the body region in light panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the start of the header region for transparent panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered at the end of the header region for transparent panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the background of the header region for transparent panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered in the body region of transparent panelBoxes at the bottom starting corner (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of transparent panelBoxes at the bottom ending corner (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region of transparent panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::transparent-bottom-start and af|panelBox::transparent-bottom-end icons.

This icon is rendered in the body region of transparent panelBoxes at the top starting corner (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of transparent panelBoxes at the top ending corner (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.) Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.

This icon is rendered in the body region of transparent panelBoxes as the background in between the af|panelBox::transparent-top-start and af|panelBox::transparent-top-end icons. Note: the top icons are only rendered for panelBoxes which do not have headers.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the starting side of the body region in transparent panelBoxes.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the ending side of the body region in transparent panelBoxes.

styleClass.description: Specifies the style information for body of the panelForm.
Specifies the style information for each cell of the panelForm.
Specifies the style information for the af:panelList content.

selector.description: Specifies the style information for af:panelList links.

styleClass.description: This style class is rendered for each header and can be used to set common properties that are shared across all header levels.
This style class is rendered on the header icon.

selector.description: This selector is used for applying styles to level one headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level two headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level three headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level four headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level five headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level six headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level one header when messageType is error.
This :alias style is included by all the HeaderLevel* named styles, which in turn is included in all the af|panelHeader::level* selectors.
This style is included by the af|*::level-one selectors and af|messages::header, af|panelHeader::error and af|messages::error (e.g., af|panelHeader::level-one, af|showDetailHeader::level-one)
This style is included by the af|*::level-two selectors (e.g., af|panelHeader::level-two, af|showDetailHeader::level-two)
This named style is included by all of the af|*::level-three, af|*::level-four, af|*::level-five, and af|*::level-six selectors

icon.description: The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "error".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "warning".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "info".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "confirmation".
The icon that is displayed for headers with messageType "processing".
The icon that is displayed for error messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::error-icon and af|messages::error-icon
The icon that is displayed for warning messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::warning-icon and af|messages::warning-icon
The icon that is displayed for information messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::info-icon and af|messages::info-icon
The icon that is displayed for confirmation messages or headers in af:messages and af:panelHeader. Changing this icon changes both af|panelHeader::confirmation-icon and af|messages::confirmation-icon

namedStyle.description: The AFFooterMessageText:alias style defines style properties that are shared by af|panelPage::about, af|panelPage::copyright, and af|panelPage::privacy style selectors.
The AFFooterMessageLink:alias style defines style properties that are shared by af|panelPage::about-link, af|panelPage::copyright-link, and af|panelPage::privacy-link style selectors.

styleClass.description: Selector for the "appAbout" facet.

selector.description: Selector for applying styles to links within the "appAbout" facet.

styleClass.description: Style class for the "appCopyright" facet.

selector.description: Selector for applying styles to links within the "appCopyright" facet.

styleClass.description: Style class for the "appPrivacy" facet.

selector.description: Selector for applying styles to links within the "privacy" facet.

description.html:p: This panelSideBar component is implemented using an inner table nested within an outer table. The outer container is used to lay out the panelSideBar's icons. The inner container contains the actual contents of the panelSideBar. If any transparent icons are used, style properties such as the background color should probably be set on the inner table via the af|panelSideBar::body style class.

styleClass.description: This style class is rendered on the panelSideBar's outer table. Since the panelSideBar's icons are rendered within the outer table, the af|panelSideBar::body style is probably a better choice for specifying the panelSideBar's background color, padding, etc...
This style class is rendered on the panelSideBar's inner table, which does not include any outer icons.

icon.description: This icon is rendered at the top starting corner of the panelSideBar (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered at the top ending corner of the panelSideBar (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the background in between the af|panelSideBar::top-start and af|panelSideBar::top-end icons.
This icon is rendered at the bottom starting corner of the panelSideBar (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered at the bottom ending corner of the panelSideBar (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the background in between the af|panelSideBar::bottom-start and af|panelSideBar::bottom-end icons.
This icon is rendered in the background at the start of the panelSideBar.
This icon is rendered in the background at the end of the panelSideBar.

The button icon which is used to launch the secondary color picker dialog. Note: This af|selectInputColor's color swatch is now used to launch the secondary dialog on most browsers. The af|selectInputColor::launch-icon icon is only displayed on browsers which do not display the color swatch, such as Netscape 4.x.
The icon that is overlayed on top of the selectInputColor's color swatch to indicate that the color swatch is clickable.
The button icon which is used to launch the secondary date picker dialog.

styleClass.description: This style class is associated with the body region of the box around the shuttle. This is inside of the af|selectManyShuttle::box-content style.
This style class is associated with the outer container of box around the shuttle.

namedStyle.description: This named style is included in af|selectOrderShuttle::box-content and af|selectManyShuttle::box-content

description.html:p: It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for shuttle's box. It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for light panelBox and for the selectMany/selectOrder shuttle's box. It is included by the following selectors:

icon.description: Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::move-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::move-icon.
Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::move-all-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::move-all-icon.
Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::remove-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::remove-icon.
Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::remove-all-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::remove-all-icon.
The icon for the af:selectManyShuttle's "Move" action.
The icon for the af:selectManyShuttle's "Move All" action.
The icon for the af:selectManyShuttle's "Remove" action.
The icon for the af:selectManyShuttle's "Remove All" action.
This icon is rendered in the body region at the bottom starting corner (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region at the bottom ending corner (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region as the background in between the af|selectManyShuttle::bottom-start and af|selectManyShuttle::bottom-end icons.
This icon is rendered in the body region at the top starting corner (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region at the top ending corner (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region as the background in between the af|selectManyShuttle::top-start and af|selectManyShuttle::top-end icons. This needs to be an icon with an url.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the starting side of the body region. This needs to be an icon with an url.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the ending side of the body region. This needs to be an icon with an url.

styleClass.description: This style class is associated with the body region of the box around the shuttle. This is inside of the af|selectOrderShuttle::box-content style.
This style class is associated with the outer container of box around the shuttle.

namedStyle.description: This named style is included in af|selectOrderShuttle::box-content and af|selectManyShuttle::box-content

description.html:p: It is included by the following selectors:
This named style is used to set the background color for shuttle's box. It is included by the following selectors:

icon.description: Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::move-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::move-icon.
Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::move-all-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::move-all-icon.
Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::remove-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::remove-icon.
Customizes both af|selectManyShuttle::remove-all-icon and a af|selectOrderShuttle::remove-all-icon.
The icon for the af:selectOrderShuttle's "Move" action.
The icon for the af:selectOrderShuttle's "Move All" action.
The icon for the af:selectOrderShuttle's "Remove" action.
The icon for the af:selectOrderShuttle's "Remove All" action.
The icon for moving the currently selected item to the top.
The icon for moving the currently selected item up by one item.
The icon for moving the currently selected item down by one item.
The icon for moving the currently selected item to the bottom.
This icon is rendered in the body region at the bottom starting corner (ie. at the bottom left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region at the bottom ending corner (ie. at the bottom right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region as the background in between the af|selectManyShuttle::bottom-start and af|selectManyShuttle::bottom-end icons.
This icon is rendered in the body region at the top starting corner (ie. at the top left corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region at the top ending corner (ie. at the top right corner for left to right languages.)
This icon is rendered in the body region as the background in between the af|selectManyShuttle::top-start and af|selectManyShuttle::top-end icons. This needs to be an icon with an url.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the starting side of the body region. This needs to be an icon with an url.
This icon is rendered as the background image on the ending side of the body region. This needs to be an icon with an url.

component.name: af:showDetail
component.description: The showDetail component allows the disclosure indicator icon to be customized.

icon.description: The af|showDetail::disclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:showDetail component is rendered in its disclosed state.
The af|showDetail::disclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:showDetail component is rendered in its undisclosed state.
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::disclosed-icon, af|showDetail::disclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::disclosed-icon, af|menuTree::disclosed-icon
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetail::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::undisclosed-icon, af|menuTree::undisclosed-icon

component.name: af:showDetailHeader
component.description: The af:showDetailHeader component allows the disclosure indicator icon to be customized.

styleClass.description: This style class is rendered for each level header and can be used to set common properties that are shared across all header levels.

selector.description: This selector is used for applying styles to level one headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level two headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level three headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level four headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level five headers.
This selector is used for applying styles to level six headers.

namedStyle.description: This named style is included by all the HeaderLevel* named styles, which in turn is included in all the af|panelHeader::level* selectors.

selector.description: This style is included by the af|*::level-one selectors and af|messages::header, af|panelHeader::error and af|messages::error (e.g., af|panelHeader::level-one, af|showDetailHeader::level-one)
This style is included by the af|*::level-two selectors (e.g., af|panelHeader::level-two, af|showDetailHeader::level-two)
This style is included by all of the af|*::level-three, af|*::level-four, af|*::level-five, and af|*::level-six selectors

icon.description: The af|showDetailHeader::disclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:showDetailHeader component is rendered in its disclosed state.
The af|showDetailHeader::undisclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:showDetailHeader component is rendered in its undisclosed state.
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::disclosed-icon, af|showDetail::disclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::disclosed-icon, af|menuTree::disclosed-icon
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetail::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::undisclosed-icon, af|menuTree::undisclosed-icon
The button icon which is used to launch the secondary list of values dialog.

namedStyle.description: This style is included in both af|showOneTab::orientation-top and af|showOneTab::orientation-bottom.

selector.description: This styles the top showOneTab. You can use this to add padding and margins and borders, for example.
This styles the bottom showOneTab. You can use this to add padding and margins and borders, for example.
This styles each unselected tab.
This styles each unselected tab link.
This styles each selected tab.
This styles each selected tab link.
This is a cell with no content that renders before the selected cell. You can style this cell to highlight the selected cell, if desired.
This is a cell with no content that renders after the selected cell. You can style this cell to highlight the selected cell, if desired.
This style is on the cells between each unselected step.
The style on the first cell. You can left-align by setting width:0% on this, and width:100% on cell-end.
The style on the last cell.
The style on the body of the showOneTab; ie., the contents.

namedStyle.description: Specifies the font family, font size and color for table data text.
Specifies the background color for data cells.
Specifies the background color for banded data cells.
Specifies the border color for data cells.
Specifies the vertical alignment for data cells.

selector.description: This style class is applied to the inner HTML table which contains the table data (column headers, row headers, and data cells).
This style class is applied to the table's top control bar.
This style class is applied to the table's bottom control bar.
This style class is applied to the table's sub control bar.
Specifies properties for detail disclosure cells.
Specifies properties for column footers.

icon.description: The af|table::disclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:table's showDetail is rendered in its disclosed state.
The af|table::undisclosed-icon icon is displayed when the af:table's showDetail is rendered in its undisclosed state.
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::disclosed-icon, af|showDetail::disclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::disclosed-icon, af|menuTree::disclosed-icon
Customizes all of these icons at once: af|table::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetail::undisclosed-icon, af|showDetailHeader::undisclosed-icon, af|menuTree::undisclosed-icon
The previous icon which is used to go back to previous step.
The next icon which is used to go back to next step.
The previous icon disabled.
The next icon disabled.

styleClass.description: Style class for the active train station.
Style class for visited train stations.
Style class for disabled train stations.
Style class for unvisited train stations.

namedStyle.description: Named style that is included by all of the af|processTrain* style classes.

selector.description: Style class for visited train stations links.
Style class for unvisited train stations links.
Style class for selectInputDate's navigation icons.
Style class for selectInputDate title.
Style class for selectInputDate header.
Style class for selectInputDate content.
Style class for selected date.

icon.description: The icon that is displayed when the checkbox is readOnly, disabled, and checked.
The icon that is displayed when the checkbox is readOnly, disabled, and unchecked.
The icon that is displayed when the checkbox is read-only and checked.
The icon that is displayed when the checkbox is read-only and unchecked.
The icon that is displayed when the radio is readOnly, disabled, and selected.
The icon that is displayed when the radio is readOnly, disabled, and not selected.
The icon that is displayed when the radio is read-only and selected.
The icon that is displayed when the radio is read-only and not selected.
The previous icon which is used to go back to previous step.
The next icon which is used to go back to next step.
The previous icon disabled.
The next icon disabled.

selector.description: Specifies properties for the tableSelectMany column.
Specifies properties for the banded tableSelectMany column.
Specifies properties for the tableSelectOne column.
Specifies properties for the banded tableSelectOne column.

styleClass.description: This style class is used to style the treeTable's expanded and collapsed icons.
This style class is used to style the treeTable's focus icon.
This style class is used to style the treeTable's locator icon.

selector.description: Specifies the style information for the path content.
Specifies the style information for the selected path step. This step may be hidden.
Specifies the style information for path steps.
This style class is applied to the inner HTML table which contains the treeTable data (column headers, row headers, and data cells).

styleClass.description: This style class is applied to the treeTable's top control bar.
This style class is applied to the treeTable's bottom control bar.
This style class is applied to the treeTable's sub control bar.

namedStyle.description: This alias namedStyle is included in both af|menuPath and af|treeTable::path
This alias namedStyle is included in both af|menuPath::step and af|treeTable::path-step
This alias namedStyle is included in both af|menuPath::selected-step and af|treeTable::path-selected-step

icon.description: This icon is displayed in expanded treeTable rows.
This icon is displayed in collapsed treeTable rows.
This icon is displayed in the focus column for focusable rows.
This icon is displayed next to the treeTable's locator bread crumbs which display the treeTable's focus path.
The separator icon that is rendered between the path links. This is typically a text icon.
Changing this icon changes both af|menuPath::separator-icon and af|treeTable::separator-icon
